info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 15 at 1:30AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...BLOWING SNOW WILL AFFECT SOUTHWESTERN ONEIDA...EASTERN CASSIA AND SOUTH CENTRAL MINIDOKA COUNTIES... There are westerly wind gusts of 30 to 55 mph. The Yale area on I-84 has the strongest winds. These winds will stay strong until 6 to 7 am when northerly winds start moving into the area. These strong winds are causing blowing and drifting of existing snow along with lower visibilities. Please check 511.idaho.gov for any road closures. Locations impacted include... Rupert, Malta, Declo, Juniper, Yale Rest Area, Idahome, Sublett Reservoir, Interstate 84 And 86 Junction, Stone, and Sweetzer Summit. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
